TopicTitle: [1.12.*] Deadly Reentry v7.9.0 The Barbie Edition, Aug 5th, 2021

Articles.Content: Also you have a huge FAR GUI and the "Ablative Shielding" in the Pod/Heatshield Info for DRE, that's for checking it out without even launching it

blackheart612: ablative shielding is a good indication that DRE is installed, but is no indication of it working (resources are separate to the actual functionality). It does, however, tell you that MM is working.
Okay, then the best way to determine it is drop a pod to Kerbin's atmosphere from an interplanetary trip. If it's destroyed from burning up, DRE's working correctly. XDDD
On a completely different note: Why is the MM shipped with DRE 1.5.7 and the official still at 1.5.6?

Starwaster I tried pm'ing you, but it says your inbox is full. So ill say it here.

The final nail in the coffin if you will on DRE's status with the reentry effect bug. I'm out of ideas so before I set DRE aside and discontinue dealing with it.. id like to ask one final time. Is there anything that can be done?

I do not know what I am doing different. My computer setup is nothing out of the ordinary.. If a fresh install of both KSP and DRE can't fix it... On top of everything we've tried for.. what's coming up on a week now...

Checkmate?

Why do my crew always died because of G force although the G force meter isn't in the danger zone?

If the ship experiences any extreme rotation that can also exert lethal gforce damage on the crew.

I am pretty new at this and have a question. How do I know if DRE and FAR are working correctly?

I don't seem to be burning up in the atmosphere on reentry. Lots of glowing but nothing blowing up. I see the heat shields in my parts so I know that bit is working but how can I find out if the model is working on reentry? Maybe it's just fluke I am not burning up but I doubt it.....

Check log for errors. Either alt+F12 or check output_log.txt to see if there's a lot of errors during reentry.

Starwaster I tried pm'ing you, but it says your inbox is full. So ill say it here.

The final nail in the coffin if you will on DRE's status with the reentry effect bug. I'm out of ideas so before I set DRE aside and discontinue dealing with it.. id like to ask one final time. Is there anything that can be done?

I do not know what I am doing different. My computer setup is nothing out of the ordinary.. If a fresh install of both KSP and DRE can't fix it... On top of everything we've tried for.. what's coming up on a week now...

Checkmate?

I don't know what to tell you at this point. It's probably some timing issue or race condition sort of thing because the only thing that (apparently) alleviated the problem at all was a build I sent you that had a bug in it that generated a ton of errors which probably slowed code execution down enough to where it stopped happening. Basically what's happening is that DRE overrides when KSP thinks reentry effects should be displayed by adjusting a variable every time the game updates. And every update, KSP re-adjusts that same variable.

Maybe if there's any quality settings you have that are lower than they could be, you could bump those up.

I don't know what to tell you at this point. It's probably some timing issue or race condition sort of thing because the only thing that (apparently) alleviated the problem at all was a build I sent you that had a bug in it that generated a ton of errors which probably slowed code execution down enough to where it stopped happening. Basically what's happening is that DRE overrides when KSP thinks reentry effects should be displayed by adjusting a variable every time the game updates. And every update, KSP re-adjusts that same variable.

Maybe if there's any quality settings you have that are lower than they could be, you could bump those up.

No.. no I've tried that.. I've tried everything. Oh well. Thanks Starwaster for your time. I just find it hard to believe I'm the only one with this problem.

Is there any way to fix parts with integrated heatshields (i.e.: Mk 1 capsule) transmitting heat to anything attached to them and blowing them up on reentry? Because it rather defeats the purpose of having a built-in heatshield if I have to add another one just so my parachutes survive being attached to the command pod.
